questions.question: What is the correct syntax to render a React component in the DOM?
options: A) ReactDOM.render(component, document.getElementById('root'))
B) React.render(component, document.getElementById('root'))
C) ReactDOM.render(component, document.querySelector('#root'))
D) ReactDom.render(component, document.getElementById('root'))

questions.question: Which of the following is a way to manage state in React?
options: A) this.props.state
B) this.state
C) this.setState
D) this.getState

questions.question: In JavaScript, what does the "===" operator do?
options: A) Compares two values for equality, but not necessarily the same type
B) Compares two values for equality, including type
C) Compares two values for inequality, but not necessarily the same type
D) Compares two values for inequality, including type
questions.answer: Compares two values for equality, including type

questions.question: What is the difference between "let" and "var" in JavaScript?
options: A) There is no difference
B) "let" can be reassigned, while "var" cannot
C) "var" can be reassigned, while "let" cannot
D) "let" is used for global variables, while "var" is used for local variables

questions.question: In React, what is the purpose of the "key" prop?
options: A) It is used to specify the component's ID
B) It is used to indicate whether the component is a child or parent
C) It is used to help React identify which items have changed, been added, or been removed in a list
D) It is used to disable the component.
questions.answer: It is used to help React identify which items have changed, been added, or been removed in a list
